title: WfCommons: A framework for enabling scientific workflow research and development

research_phases.evidence: Section 3.1 (WfInstances): collection and curation of workflow execution instances from real executions using WMSs.
Section 3.2 (WfChef): analysis of real workflow instances to discover task dependency patterns and model performance characteristics.
Section 3.3 (WfGen): generation of synthetic workflow instances based on recipes and desired task counts.
Section 3.4 (WfSim) and Section 4: simulation of workflows and experimental evaluation of realism and accuracy.
Section 5: case study estimating energy consumption of large-scale workflows.

summary: The paper presents WfCommons, a comprehensive framework supporting simulation-driven scientific workflow research through the collection, analysis, generation, and simulation of workflow instances. It defines clear workflow stages, inputs, outputs, and tools, supported by architectural and process diagrams. Extensive experimental comparisons demonstrate that WfCommons produces more realistic synthetic workflows than prior approaches.
